meanings.definition: The act of bringing up or caring for offspring.
meanings.sent1: Her rearings of the baby bird were gentle and loving.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper's rearings of the lion cubs were meticulous and attentive.
meanings.sent3: The rearings of the little ducklings by the mother hen was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The rearings of the young sapling by the gardener ensured its healthy growth.
meanings.sent5: His rearings of the puppies were filled with patience and dedication.

meanings.definition: The way in which a horse or other animal is trained or brought up.
meanings.sent1: The expert's rearings of the wild stallion were successful and impressive.
meanings.sent2: Proper rearings of a puppy are essential for its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The rearings of the circus elephant were both entertaining and educational.
meanings.sent4: His rearings of the show dogs were so effective that they won many competitions.
meanings.sent5: The rearings of the racehorses required patience and skill from the trainers.

meanings.definition: The process of raising or lifting something up.
meanings.sent1: The rearings of the heavy boxes onto the truck were tiring but necessary.
meanings.sent2: The rearings of the flag during the ceremony were done with precision.
meanings.sent3: The rearings of the hot air balloon into the sky were met with cheers from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The rearings of the sunken ship from the ocean floor took months of planning.
meanings.sent5: The rearings of the curtain revealed the grand stage to the audience.
